file_content.text: This sector's locked up. The last few pockets of resistance are being mopped up, and soon Corellia will be at peace.
Colonel Wolroff is dead, and the prison defenses are reprogrammed.
Excellent news! Without their hero, the remaining resistance will fall apart.
The security systems are reprogrammed. It's just a matter of time now.
Good, good. Darth Decimus will be pleased when I report this evening.
And with CorSec's little bastion all locked up, the rest of Corellia will be easy to bring under control. Time to get some real government established.
With CorSec out of the way, you shouldn't meet much resistance.
You can handle it from here.
Those left will fight back, but yes--with the prison secured, they're effectively finished.
If you give these people any leeway, the resistance will start again.
Rule them with a firm hand.
Don't worry. This sector will remain secure, by any means necessary.
I'll include your heroics in my report.
That was a miserable fight.
There's nowhere left for the resistance to hide. They're finished, even if they don't know it.
Until all the security systems are re-programmed, CorSec will just move to safe zones where they can't be targeted.
Moff. How are things faring?
You're an inspiration. Thanks to your push against the Green Jedi, the Empire has almost cleansed the planet of Republic influences.
It's just a matter of time, my lord. The Republic cannot turn the tide.
Even a mercenary should appreciate the good a stable government will do here.
Before long, Corellia's industry will be the pride of the Empire; her star will be brighter than ever.
Soon, Corellia will be completely pacified. All that remains is to secure CorSec's maximum security prison. The resistance is defending it fiercely.
The whole point of a prison is to keep people in.
A prison is easy to secure.
Those walls work both ways--they're just as good at keeping us out.
You'll finish the job.
Three attempts, and we've barely pushed past the outer defenses.
Every sector must be secured. This one is no exception.
Delays won't be tolerated.
I understand that. Darth Decimus has made his plans clear.
CorSec is using the prison as a staging area for attacks against Imperial forces. They've made the place all but impenetrable.
They've even turned the prison security systems against us--they don't target CorSec forces, so it's like having an automated army defending the place.
There must be a way to disable the systems.
Security can be overridden.
The prison generates its own power, so there's no way from outside. But you may be right.
A small assault team could slip in and reprogram the systems at several control nodes in the prison.
If CorSec is living in the prison, where are the inmates?
What about the prisoners?
Most offered to help CorSec for a shortened sentence. A captured prisoner gave us vital information about the security systems.
You must be incompetent.
Feel free to lead another assault. Darth Decimus will be interested in why you sacrificed more men, assuming you survive the security systems.
They can't be shut down, but a small assault team could slip in and reprogram them at several control nodes in the prison.
Those systems could be altered to target CorSec directly--the defenders would be cut down by their own defenses. Can I count on your assistance?
I relish bringing an end to this uprising.
It will be my pleasure.
Their fear will be a sweet chorus in the tapestry of the Force.
I relish the opportunity.
A full-on fortress run? Step back and let a professional handle this.
Sounds like my kind of job.
CorSec won't know I'm there until it's too late.
I'll be happy to handle it.
Once the security systems are reprogrammed, they'll eliminate the resistance for us.
Once this area is secure, maybe Corellia can move forward.
Ending the fight is worth it.
That's my hope as well, but there can be no future while CorSec and the resistance insist on living in the past.
The resistance leader is Colonel Wolroff. His attacks have been a thorn in the Empire's side for too long.
Securing the prison is essential, but Wolroff's death would leave a wonderfully ugly hole in the resistance command structure.
Find another. [Refuse quest]
Of course, it was foolish of me to think you'd help. Don't worry, we'll find a way to finish the job.
Lovely planet, Corellia. Soon the war will be over and we can get down to the business of government.
